website_summaries.verdict: Though it comes at a lower price, the Munchkin edges it out slightly in design and odor control.
pros: It's lightweight and works with any type of trash bags
cons: The lid is somewhat awkward to shut, and odors have the tendency to escape

customer_reviews.title: Attn New Parents! Don't buy a diaper genie! Get this instead
customer_reviews.text: I get so riled up about products that target the naïveté of new parents and rip them off. You do not, I repeat, do NOT need a fancy garbage can for dirty diapers, especially one that has replacement bags that are over triple the cost of regular trash bags. You only need a regular trash can with a lid that latches (so your mobile baby and/or pets can't get in) and a Costco sized box of regular kitchen trash bags. Bought this diaper pail for my second baby and kick myself constantly for not getting it with my 1st. This should be one of those "#1 piece of advice for new parents" things
customer_reviews.author: nbeardsley

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this diaper bin
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this diaper bin. We read that these were an unecessary purchase but I disagree. We bought a reusable liner and I found an arm and hammer odor blocker that actually went to a different brand on clearance. It fit fine and no odor escapes the bin. We even have it in our bedroom next to his changing table.
customer_reviews.author: Chad K

customer_reviews.title: Very satisified
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put my dogs potty pads in and it's the best. It works exactly as described. I keep it in my laundry room, fill the deodorizer cup with baking soda and only have to take the bag out once a week on garbage day instead of every day outside to the trash. There is a slight odor on the last day before trash pick up but it's not awful. I spray the can with disinfecting spray before putting a fresh bag in. I think if it works this well for puppy pads, it must work for diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Medonic

customer_reviews.title: No more smell and small enough to fit in the tiny bathroom!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother-in-law who is in an assisted living facility. She wears adult diapers and she would just put them in the waste basket. The room would smell like urine all the time. Since getting this, there is no more smell. It's easy for her to use. Best buy in a while! I looked at a LOT of diaper pails (for adults) and was a little reluctant and wondered if it would help. It did the trick. And it's small enough in her tiny bathroom that it doesn't get in the way. This is the answer!
customer_reviews.author: Jorin

customer_reviews.title: Does not seal
customer_reviews.text: I gave this three stars because it does use regular kitchen size garbage bags. But there are two major design flaws. It does not seal where the hinge sits. The odor is reduced but the room still has the scent of dirty diaper pail. The second flaw is how far down the deodorizer container sits. It covers a major part of the opening. Big full diapers will have to be wedged in. Ick.
customer_reviews.author: K. L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a diaper pail that would seal out bacteria from diapers better than a standard open lid garbage. I didn't mind the smell, but It does a great job to conceal smell as well. Necessary item for new parents, and more efficient than the diaper genie bcs it holds more and you can use regular bags. trust me you don't want to use just a standard garbage can for soiled diapers, you've got to seal those bad boys.
customer_reviews.author: ariselis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but not worth it. Doesn't do the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible item. It's cheap, but not worth it to be cheap here. Every time it has a diaper in it, the smell seeps through and goes to the plastic, and it needs to be aired out outside for a few hours until I can bring it back into my house. It's way too big, so holds too many diapers and the smell when you try to change the bag is enough to make one pass out. Better to buy a stainless steel diaper pail, that has better odor control.
customer_reviews.author: Tzippora G.

customer_reviews.title: It’s good when you modify it!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than we thought. Absolutely recommended the activated carbon trick. Take a drill and make lots of holes on the scent remover cup, grab an old stocking from your wife and fill her up with activated carbon for fish tanks, tie it up and fit it in. No smells coming from that garbage yet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With a suggested modification, and activated charcoal, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I read the review that suggested modifying this pail by adding more holes to the deodorizer cup and using activated charcoal in panty-hose instead of the included deodorizing puck. The modification was easy, and this pail has way less (virtually no) smell as compared to our diaper genie. Pros: -Holds way more diapers than a diaper genie -After modification, has way less smell Cons: -The spring-open lid spring is not very strong; I often need to lift it open manually. -The lid opens by push-button instead of foot-pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love! I had an arm and hammer diaper genie but the lid broke and I was tired of buying specific bags. This is so much better. It’s way bigger so you don’t have to empty as often. I used my regular tall kitchen garbage bags in it. It does cut down on smell to use the febreze garbage bags though. Also love the lower price!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this diaper pail for the following reasons
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this diaper pail for the following reasons: 1) Does not hold in diaper odors, even when emptied regularly and aired out outside for an entire day. 2) Tried the Safety 1st and another deodorizer disc, and neither worked to reduce the odor. 3) This thing is way too big and for the design conscious, just a giant beige plastic (and smelly!) garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, better than a trash can, not quite as good as other diaper pails on odor, but very cost effective
customer_reviews.text: It works great if you haven't had another diaper pail. If you used diaper genie or arm & hammer pail, then it doesn't work as well with odors, but the big advantage is that you don't have to buy proprietary bags for ridiculous prices every month. I'd recommend this to anyone who hasn't got a special bag pail yet.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: More practical than the Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: I hated my Diaper Genie which was getting jammed every since they changed the design. I originally bought this as a second diaper pail for downstairs where I tend to change my baby during the day and ended up ditching the Diaper Genie and getting a second one of these. It holds a lot of diapers and I've never smelled an odor coming from it. My only (tiny) complaint is that the little odor disc makes a rattling sound when you open the top which is annoying when you have an extremely light sleeper for a newborn! You can remove the odor container thing to make more room for diapers if you wanted.
customer_reviews.author: xtopherous

customer_reviews.title: Buy now -- you won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these. We cloth diaper and use one for laundry and one for garbage (wipes, disposables, etc). My Grovia and PlanetWise liners, as well as the Glad trash bags I use in my kitchen, work perfectly. However, the air fresheners fall off frequently and one of the two doesn't open with a spring (it is still rather simple to do manually). These are the best option for what we need and by far more reasonably priced than other options available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t spend more than $15 to hold poop!
customer_reviews.text: Had a friend give us an Ubbi that no amount of baking soda or vinegar could get the smell from their child out of. Started with a Munchkin that only held about 8-10 diapers before having to change the bag and still stunk. Picked this up on a whim at Kmart one day with our first child and will use it for our second for sure. You can jam pack it full and it still doesn’t reek even after a poopy diaper change. It’s a bit unpleasant when you finally decide to empty it but once the bag is gone it’s great! Highly recommend. We even bought one to use for cat litter, and we have 4 cats!
customer_reviews.author: Nik Eng

customer_reviews.title: Good Price With Modification
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the pride point and used the marine charcoal as another reviewer suggested. And this works great! Annoyances: Huge sticker does not peel off easily! I’m still working at it, one tiny, torn strip at a time. It’s an off-white color (odd choice to me) It’s short enough that you need to bend to press the button to open and close and while holding a newborn, that can make it a bit awkward. The taller, foot pedal brand is much more convenient. Bags do not tuck in the rim at all, so it looks a bit “trashy”. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: Arixht

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: They heated the plastic wrap to make it stick to hamper. GREAT!!! it does not peel off. I am going to have to use gunk remover to get all the sticky mess off the top. It is already getting dirt stuck on it on the top of the hamper. Nothing I love more than having to clean up a hard to remove sticky mess before I can use a brand new product. AND what is with having to use two hands to open the pail. Hello, one hand has a dirty diaper it in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for multi-use
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail replaces one just like it that I purchased over 25 years ago, to have on hand when my grandkids came to visit. When they outgrew the need for it, I put it on my back patio to use for our dogs' poo. After all those years, the hot New Mexico climate finally caused a crack in the lid, so I had to replace it recently. A scented trash bag and the scented tablets in the lid keep the odor minimal, until we depose of it in the weekly trash pickup. It has worked great for that purpose, and it is inconspicuous in the corner of the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a diaper pail that has individual bags (especially since Amazon recommended getting some to go with it). I was a little surprised when it arrived and just took the regular 13 gal or less garbage bags. I'm actually happy for this surprise as it is so much easier, is going to be a lot cheaper than the individual small bags and works like a charm. You just put a garbage bag in it like you would any garbage can, drop an scent disk into the designated area and away you go. Diapers go in a small easy to open door that flips open on the top and shuts tight to keep the smells from rising.
customer_reviews.author: jmpaes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pail and price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first diaper pail and I’m so happy with my purchase. Super affordable, nothing too fancy, neutral color and even more importantly it works. I use the purifyou carbon filters in the scent storage compartment and that also seems to help substantially. The great part about this diaper pail is that you can actually use it to dispose regular trash too (like disposable wipe cases that finish) and you can use regular grocery bags. It makes me feel much less guilty about buying a diaper pail. I don’t have to invest extra really and it’s incredibly successful at serving its purpose
customer_reviews.author: Brown2018

customer_reviews.title: Does not trap odors
customer_reviews.text: This does not trap any odors of even just wet diapers, let alone poopy diapers. It is simply awful. I saw a lot of good reviews for this, so I was hopeful it would be a good product at a good price. This did not live up to its good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: TiBowers

customer_reviews.title: Loving this diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is so easy to use and I'm so happy that I took the advice of the previous reviewer and bought it along with the charcoal and pantyhose for odor control. It's amazing and well worth the money. Get it!!
customer_reviews.author: ksc

customer_reviews.title: Save on bag purchase
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed many of diaper pails and decided on this one because it uses regular (13 gal) trash bags. You can use a smaller bag; the convenience is you can use anything that fits. Was Leary about the smell because it does not have the lock out, push down sausage type system. But I followed the directions on one of the reviews, drilled additional holes in the ventilator and added the charcoal stocking. WORKS great! 2 weeks no smell so far. Will update in a couple weeks
customer_reviews.author: LaDeDa

customer_reviews.title: I have to change the bag liner constantly which is a good and a bad
customer_reviews.text: Since this pail is so short, I have to change the bag liner constantly which is a good and a bad. Good in the fact the dirty bag doesn’t stay around long enough but bad because you can go through 3-4 bags a week. It can get pricey. Even changing out the bag as often as I do, in addition with the pods to help with the odor, I end up changing the pods out every week too.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Peters

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it and highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 senior chihuahuas that wear belly bands 24/7. I had a basket for the soiled bands but the urine odor was over powering if we didn’t wash them constantly. We have been using this pail for almost a week now with the activated carbon trick another reviewer shared. We pushed out washing the bands to put it to the test. Tomorrow will be day 7 and there is NO ODOR!
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this over “fancy” diaper pails.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these. I lost the piece to hold the deodorizer in it so I ended up purchasing a second one. It’s inexpensive, I can use any garbage bag, it doesn’t smell, and does exactly what a garbage can is supposed to do. Moms to be, don’t waste your (or someone else’s) money on a “fancy” diaper pail. This is all you need, especially for middle of the night diaper changes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds in the smell
customer_reviews.text: This is our third diaper pail in 3 years. I wish I would have bought this one in the first place. It works just as well as the way more expensive ones we had previously. It's simpler than the others with no frills but really as long as it holds in the scent does anything else matter?
customer_reviews.author: bellablue

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly effective and affordable to outfit!
customer_reviews.text: Shockingly effective!!! So simply designed, and so inexpensive to equip (with inexpensive deodorizer cartridges and regular old tall kitchen bags), it's hard to be how perfectly this product CONTAINS odor. . .Plus its capacity is multiple times that of the diaper pails one now sees in stores everywhere. . .Get this great product, at this great price, and you'll have no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I’d known about this pail sooner. It’s small enough to not leave a major foot print and big enough to hold a lot of diapers! I 1st saw this pail when I visited my cousin. She raved about not needing expensive pails and her son’s pull ups being too big for those bags that go in the expensive pails to be worth buying. I finally bought one- with my 2 babes, we we’re going through the expensive diaper bags like water! Using kitchen bags to line them and filling them up, too? Where has this pail been hiding?! This pail is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Fairest1ofall

customer_reviews.title: Add activated charcoal and its the best pail
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pail for my son and it works great. The size is perfect and it fits standard bags. I listened to other reviews and used activated charcoal in nylon socks for the smell and haven't had any issues. My husband drilled a couple extra holes in the holder and once it starts to kind of smell, we change out the charcoal. If we didn't use the activated charcoal, it would have smell issues, so I took a star away, but since most diapers pails have issues i still think it's worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kadi

customer_reviews.title: Holds smell in decently even without descenting tab thing.
customer_reviews.text: its big, its alot cheaper than the branded diaper pails, it USE YOUR USUAL TRASH BAGS and holds up very well. it takes maybe 4 days to a week for it to fill up depending your baby's age. it was durable. It worked AMAZING BEFORE SOLID FOODS, and after solids, when it fills up alittle, it doesnt hold the scent in perfectly. and if you ever got poop smeared on it, it is really hard to clean up. but it is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: BriannaD

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing to stop smell
customer_reviews.text: I got this to put my elder dog's soiled reusable diapers while waiting for laundry day, because the smell of dog pee was terrible. Unfortunately, it does NOTHING to stop the smell, even with the deodorizer. The lid has visible gaps through which I am sure the smell is escaping. I put a plastic garbage bag over it and that seemed to help, along with setting an odor-trapping product from amazing on top of the pail. I can't really afford a fancier diaper pail, so I'll have to make do. Potential buyers should know that they can't rely on this to stop odor. otherwise it is convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Can still smell the diapers
customer_reviews.text: To be completely honest, this doesn't really work. I have this in my bedroom and can smell the dirty diapers I put in here just as much as if it were a regular trash can. I previously owned the dekor brand, and it worked much better. However, I do like that you can use regular trash bags with this. And it is cheaper. However, I can't live with the smell, so I'm probably going to end up selling out the extra money for another dekor.
customer_reviews.author: Alei

customer_reviews.title: Look no further.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for our dogs waste and it is amazing. I love the fact that it is a quick press of a button to open it and just as quick to close it. Regarding smell - we typically take out the bag (we use regular 13gal bags) weekly or within a week and a half and the smell stays inside. I bought the charcoal that others Suggested and I have not had the need to use it. I recommend it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: JEOV

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was a good value compared to others on the market. I like that you don’t need a specific bag to use it. I just use an 8/13 gall kitchen trash bag. We’re we’re using a regular step trash can prior but our yorkie kept in getting into the dirty diapers and ripping them out. Gross I know. I like that this opens from the top to avoid that problem. That was the selling point.
customer_reviews.author: Judy C.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: Wish I knew how annoying the Diaper Genie would be with the spring loaded lid. This works much better for diapers and wipes. You just pop the top, drop in your stinky/dirty stuff, and flip the top closed. The Diaper Genie has a spring loaded trap door you must press past which just seems less sanitary, and much more difficult when you are trying to deal with a fussy newborn. I am trashing our diaper genie and adding a 2nd one of these to our upstairs changing area.
customer_reviews.author: Fleming23

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: My husband has ALZ and he has actually remembered how to press the button to open the top and dispose of items! I did use another deodorizer in the cup and I found that the 8 gallon trash bags are much easier to use with this. The only complaint is that I wish it were more of a rectangle shape so it could sit beside the toilet. But overall this is very handy for senior needs.
customer_reviews.author: Treeland

customer_reviews.title: Not any better than a lidded trash can
customer_reviews.text: This pail really isn’t much better than a trash can with a lid. The deodorizing puck that it came with only worked for a week or two (and by worked I mean was better than nothing) then I bought another brand from Amazon that worked ok for a while, but now it barely keeps the smell in at all even with replacing deodorizing products. Also the mechanism to open it is broken already (I’ve only used this for a couple months) and just pops open randomly. I have to keep something heavy on top to keep it closed.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Now it is just a regular trash can
customer_reviews.text: Overall i like the idea. Easy to use. However, the compartment for tablet us hard to open/close. Really hard. after 2 weeks of use the cover it is now gone. My guess i had hard time locking it in and it fell off in to the diaper bag. Unnoticed my guess it got thrown out. The main feature is now gone. I used putty to stick the tablet to the lid. But i am unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Eves

customer_reviews.title: Sticker won't come off
customer_reviews.text: The diaper pail itself is great, tall and fairly easy to open and throw a diaper in. The reason I give it 3 stars is because the darn sticker on the front. I want it to come off easily! But that stupid thing has fought me at every freaking turn. I've decided to cover it with something rather than try and unstick the rest of it. It makes me.. irrationally angry. So if you'd like good diaper pail for cheap, and don't mind a huge unsightly sticker on it for the rest of time, get this trashcan.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Venditta

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This really does hold the smell. I use it for disposing cat excrements 😂 The only complaint I have is that I'm not sure if the garbage bag is supposed to be hanging outside the bin or not. The instructions aren't really clear, and it seems like there's a way to keep the bag on the inside, but I can't seem to get that to work. Other than that, this is great for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Fleury

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but lid closes too easily
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a fine diaper pail. I use it for cloth diapers. I open the large lid to toss them in. The annoying part is that the lid does not stay up well when putting in the pail liner or leaving it open to put in multiple diapers after daycare.
customer_reviews.author: Raas Imare

customer_reviews.title: Not Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, especially because it opened on the top with a button rather than a foot pedal. Contains smell at first but then it does creep out of the container. I’ve tried filters both in the dome and the bottom of the can and doesn’t help. Even after changing the bags the stench of the actual container is overwhelming. Being able to use regular bags isn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: GriffMa

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. Very good quality for the price. No need to purchase special bags you can use any 13 gallon bags. It keeps the smell contained. It suggests you use the munchkin arm and hammer freshener but I got the febreeze small spaces air freshener refills and it works fine. The only thing I have to say is that I'm 5'3" and I still have to bend over to reach and press the button to open it. I can see that being an inconvenience for someone who is tall.
customer_reviews.author: Soany Medina

customer_reviews.title: Totally trash
customer_reviews.text: After looking up some good reviews about it I thought it at least it's a tight trash can which may hold up some smells or just a regular tight trash can which is fine... well after receiving I see it's not tight at all and you can see some gaps in the lid...I don't know what's the purpose for this trash can for diaper? Plus the open lid is so inconvenient, is this a trash can or just a simply trash?
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great because no special bags
customer_reviews.text: I like this diaper pail better than others because you can use a regular trash bag with it. It is simple and easy to use. It can be smelly when you open and there are dirty diapers in it, but others I have tried did the same thing and the special bags were a pain. This is the second time I’ve bought this item. After a 2.5 years, the plastic seemed to have absorbed the smell so I purchased a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, it doesn't do the one thing is supposed to do, keep odors in
customer_reviews.text: This product is a joke, even when fully closed it has plenty of holes where the smell of puppy diapers can come out through, and come out it does. Whatever room this thing is will stink to high heavens after a couple of days. Eventually we replaced the thing with one of the more expensive diaper pails here (made out of metal, closes hermetically) and never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: iR

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is a complete disappointment. The large lid (what you open to change the liner) is 100% easy enough for even a young toddler to open and play with poop diapers. Also, there's a ginormous sticker on the front of the trashcan that CANNOT be peeled off. These are very simple issues that I discovered in the two minutes I have owned this trash can. Absolutely not. Back to the store!
customer_reviews.author: Shredder

customer_reviews.title: Works okay. Wish it opened more easily.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well, and it wasn't too expensive. I like that you can use any regular garbage bag. I haven't noticed any smell in the room, which is awesome. (Of course, my baby is still young and exclusively breastfed, so we'll see if this changes when her poop gets more smelly.)The biggest flaw is that it doesn't open easily. The button is close to the middle of the lid, which is not a very firm plastic, so when I push on it, it pushes the whole lid in rather than just the button. This means it's hard to actually operate one-handed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather K

customer_reviews.title: Smell is terrible
customer_reviews.text: After about a week, the smell was terrible. If we don’t change the bag every day, the entire nursery smells like a dirty diaper. We will have to replace this with another product.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great, hard time getting then label
customer_reviews.text: I really like this diaper pail. It works great at neutralizing the smell and you can use regular trash bags in it. My only complaint is the sticker with their product information located on the front, it took me FOREVER to peel it off.... more like scrape... I had to get a razor blade and still it came off in itty bitty pieces. It left a ton of residue which I scrubbed with alcohol and a washcloth which still Didn’t do the trick. Other than that it’s a great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Derulo

customer_reviews.title: Love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: Not to be weird but I bought this for my 87 year-old mother's incontinence diapers. Everyday I kept smelling something so horrible and I realized it was the diapers coming from her bathroom. I bought this thing and it is a lifesaver. I can't smell anything at all anymore. I bought the little arm & Hammer freshener things to put on the top lid, those are a must!
customer_reviews.author: bawstongirl

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: So I took someones elses advice on here for modifying the pail for smell using activated charcoal. This works fantastic. Too bad bad if you don't empty this every day the smell when you try and empty this thing is horrible. I do daycare and it takes more then a week to fill this thing. So it waste garbage bags.
customer_reviews.author: momof3

customer_reviews.title: Minimal smell, easy to use, easy to change
customer_reviews.text: We keep it in our bedroom. The smell is faintly there if the bag is full but otherwise does the trick. Fairly sturdy. Release button has enough tension that my 16 month old can't open it. For the price, this gets the job done. I kicked the diaper genie to the curb because I was tired of buying specialized trash bags that filled up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Can't contain the smell
customer_reviews.text: We knew that by buying a cheaper pail we might not get the same results we had with a more expensive model, but we were surprised how quickly the smell leaked with this pail. We change the bag every few days and have begun to put a bowl full of baking soda in the bottom to soak up some of the smell, but it's still possible to smell the diapers from the next room. It seems that diaper pails are an area where it's better to spend a bit more to get higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Schoenhals

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should!
customer_reviews.text: I struggle to remove lid each time to remove the back but other than that it's great.nim not using anything for the scent yet an fit hasn't been an issue it has a tight close and does the trick. Much easier to use this with regular bags than having to purchase the ginie refills. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Large size, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love this diaper pail. Bought it for the 5 of our grandchildren who are in diapers. The reason I gave it a 4 star instead of a 5 is because the product label (which is large) is impossible to get off. I used goo gone, acetone, and soft scrub and it is still sticky and part of the sticker just wouldn’t come off. No one wants an ugly label on anything. Other than that, I think it will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Mrslrob1

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy a diaper genie. Get this!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant for the price. Keeps odor out, uses any kitchen garbage bag, fits lots of dirty diapers. We have the bin in the room near the bed and there is no smell. The opening on top is enough to put in diapers and for the big full dirty diapers we simply open the lid (the one used for changing bags) and put it in. I clean the lid and the push button with a sanitizing wipe regularly to keep it hygienic. If the smell bothers you, you could put different deodorizer or room freshener or something in the lid. In conclusion, absolutely brilliant for the price!

customer_reviews.title: Great can for diapers!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is amazing. Never thought I'd say that about a can for poop filled diapers but seriously it's great! I received it middle of March and it's now the end of March and I haven't emptied it. It holds a ton and keeps the smell in! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Henning

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our son's cloth diapers after reading multiple reviews. So far we have not been disappointed. I wasn't sure if the small opening would be large enough for cloth, but it is. And it has definitely cut back on the stink. Sometimes we can go up to a week between washes and our old pail would get stinky. We use planet wise pail liners and they hold in place very well.
customer_reviews.author: dmc

customer_reviews.title: It Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I have twins and they each have their own room. This means they each have their own changing station along with a "community" one downstairs. Originally they shared a room so we had two expensive pails from baby showers. However, they had to be split up...hence why we have three pails now. This pail does just as good of a job as any of the other ones we have. Not only does it collect a LOT of diapers but it also has a fragrance holder in case you have some magical item that soaks up diaper smells. By default it does a great job of masking sent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Needed a separate diaper dispenser for our bedroom since it's in the basement and this is the perfect size. It actually does seem to hold in the smell - it isn't bothersome at all and I actually leave the lid open most of the time. You don't need to buy special liners or bags, just the cheap little scent tokens that do their job well. I am not sure why the container for the scent tokens is so big, but it really doesn't get in the way. Easy to clean and use and totally serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie K

customer_reviews.title: Great design, contains the smells!
customer_reviews.text: Very well-designed! So smart to have the small opening in the lid for dropping in the dirties without releasing a lot of odor into the room! We used this with disposable diapers originally, and now we're using it for cloth diapers, along with the Planet Wise diaper pail liner. Either way, it contains the smells very well - and we don't even use the (admittedly toxic smelling) odor cake thing in the center (it's gone, must have fell into our trash bag and been tossed when one of us didn't realize it was missing in the first place). If you're into that kind of thing, make sure it's secured tightly to the lid!
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Not just for diapers, but also kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: I use this bin to store kitty little waste between trips to the garbage. I clean my cat's litter box everyday and this container keeps the room odor free, you would never think cat waste was in the area. If it can seal in cat waste ordors as well as it does, it definitely works great with baby diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper pail I have ever used. But I also get store bought deodorizer cakes and put those in, that works better than the deodorizer things that come with this. I use plastic grocery bags with it. I empty it twice a week. We keep it in the bathroom. The odor is non-existent with these measures and doesn't cost anything more than the initial cost.
customer_reviews.author: QueenBee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the nursery.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our dog likes to get into the trash 🙄. Best purchase! This holds a significant amount of diapers and I cannot smell them at all when the lid is closed. I don’t notice the smell when it’s open either; however, I don’t leave it open except to throw the diaper away. I empty it once a week on trash day and that’s it. We have a 7 week old right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper pail! I love i can just use a regular garabage nahhhh and not have to but specifical inserts spending more money on literally trash. Lol a great buy and keeps most thre smell contained as long as you don't overfill it.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdymom93

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor dog poop container
customer_reviews.text: I use this out on my back patio to store my dogs poop. It works perfectly for this purpose as I don't ever smell any odor coming from it. I empty it once a week on garbage pick up day which is way better than dropping smelly poop bags into my main trash can and having them sit there all week.
customer_reviews.author: gwr65

customer_reviews.title: used
customer_reviews.text: obviously when I received it, it had already been used. It was not in it's original box, had a piece of tape holding the lid closed, was scratched up on the bottom. and had a weird odor inside.... Expected better than this treatment, as I have been a member since 2004
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: Uses regular garbage bags, great savings!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to get away from needing to buy special bags and scents for our diaper pail. This works great. We simply use a scented bag with some baking soda discs and that’s it. Not having to spend tons of money on special bags makes this well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dog doodoo
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this since we have nowhere to throw away our dogs' #2 and going to the waste containers multiple times a day is just a pain. This coupled with activated carbon and a room scent has been a great addition and we are able to clean out once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Misha Venter

customer_reviews.title: Uses regular trash bags!
customer_reviews.text: Love this diaper pail. It’s one of the only diaper pails that doesn’t need fancy bags. It’s easy to open and close and the lid has a special compartment for an air freshener. The poop smell does escape a bit when you open it but it’s minimal and definitely worth it for the price and ability to use regular trash bags
customer_reviews.author: curiocity

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the things we didn't know we needed until the baby came along. What attracted us to this unit was its price and the fact that it doesn't depend on its own branded bags. It has good capacity and does a great job of containing odor. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: KCinNYC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats box clean up too!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect exactly what I needed, I scoop the cast box into scented dog poop bags knot it and it fits perfectly through the top lid, the sent makes it not smell at all in the room couldn't be more thrilled!!!! I put a tall kitchen garbage bag in it and vwala a perfect kitty tool.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT hold in the smell at all. I have it lined with a quality trash bag. I'm using the included deodorizing disk. I empty every other day AND I first tie the diapers up in scented Sassy Diaper Sacks. Needs to be more air tight. It is cheaply priced and easy to "use".
customer_reviews.author: KG621

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: If you have more than 1 kids that use diapers, this is what you should use. It can hold way more than other fancy products, which use their proprietary bags. This bucket can hold a lot more content and uses the normal thrash bags. Its odor controller is also pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well and i followed the carbon pantyhose ball instructions in the Q&A salection to improve odor absorbsion. Would be nice if lid latch was slighly lower than rim of basket to allow the bags to fold over rim all the way around. Seals could be better but for like $26 itt is as good as one 5 times more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Dubbs

customer_reviews.title: Not just for diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have this next to my litter box. I use small scented diaper baggies and dispose of them into the pail, which has a regular 13 gallon kitchen bag in it. I toss out the bag once a week on garbage day. Holds in odors. Perfect for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Lore

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: Great for cloth diapers! We use it with the planet wise pail liner. My only complaint is that it's a bit top heavy. I like to leave the whole lid open for maximum ventilation (cloth diaper people - I hope you know this trick! more air=less stink! open pail full of s***ty diapers emits less stench than a closed one in my experience!) Anyway, when the lid is open and there aren't may diapers in there it tends to fall over backwards if it's not against the wall. It's a great size. For me, when it's full, I wash and that is every 2-3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah in TX

customer_reviews.title: Stink Pail!
customer_reviews.text: It does nothing to cover the stank! You can smell it in the next room with the lid shut even hours later. I wouldn't buy this again. I've been through a few diaper pails now having 3 kids and doing daycare...it's $20 for a reason. I was hoping to get a bargain, I should have known better. Save your nose and spend just a little more for a better quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Baby newborn must have
customer_reviews.text: Must buy if you have a baby/child in diapers and you dont want your room/house to smell. Once you put the diaper in, the smell is literally trapped in there until you dump it. Not cheaply made. I'm glad I bought this shortly after I had my baby. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Big pail but doesn't hold the smell
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this pail it definitely takes a lot of diapers however it does not hold the smell in at all especially an older toddlers stinky diapers. I tried putting in different kinds of odor absorbing products in the lid but nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: sumaya

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my cat litter bags until it’s time to take the main trash out. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: We like it but it does not keep out the smell
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my second child. We like it but it does not keep out the smell. In order to combat that we've put the extra ripe ones in a bag first then put it in the bin and that did help. Would have given it 5 stars if it kept out the smell better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pet litter trash can
customer_reviews.text: I put a litter box filter and a dryer sheet in the filter of this can. I use scented trash bags and I don't smell the soiled litter I put in the can. I don't think I need all of that , I just wanted to make sure I don't smell cat litter. I love this trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: Great diaper pail! Can’t beat the price. We have a very expensive can and two of the Safety 1st pails - I would have likely skipped the expensive can if I knew I would like this product so much. You definitely need a deodorizer. We love being able to use a regular trash bag. Again, great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharha

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. We’ve been using this diaper garbage pail for only 2 months and we are throwing it out to purchase a diaper genie. This one stinks HORRIBLY, does not contain the scent at all. So bad that our bathroom is upstairs where this is located and can smell it all the way downstairs! Does nothing for containing the scent!!!! Emptied weekly - doesn’t help. Used essential oils like lemon and peppermint to mask the scent - didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Broken Safety 1st Easy Save Diaper Pail
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been looking for a diaper pail that will fit in our Pottery Barn changing table. We ordered the Safety 1st Easy Save Diaper Pail from Dorel Juvenile Group and it arrived broken (the lid button didn't work) and defective (the deodorizer under the lid was missing). We liked the diaper pail otherwise and wanted to exchange it for a new one, but when I went back to make the purchase the item was no longer available on Prime + $10 more. This seems very odd. I wish they made it easier to make this purchase. We will keep looking. Hope this helps you save your time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solved my dilemma
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and assemble. I love it. Can use Stick-Up odor control easily... Good for disabled people and/or pet people for pad and feces disposal. No special bags needed. No tearing off bags, no tying knots in the end of bags.... Ahhhhhh.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Holds so many diapers. I was surprised. So thankful this doesn’t need those stupid refill bags. Nice not to purchase more than I already need to. Can not smell anything either. Even when full. Easy to empty.
customer_reviews.author: Well

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite diaper pails. I'm on my third kid and third pail. The inner lid just don't seem to hold up well to multiple kids diaper changes a day and eventually the springs break free and I just buy a new pail. But for the cost and how well this functions with a waterproof bag for cloth diapers and wipes, I will continue to buy this pail as often as need be!! We've tried this for regular diapers before but it just holds too many before the smell gets bad. But for cloth, this thing fills up fast and smell is never a problem. I highly recommend for all you cloth diapering families out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hugginkiss

customer_reviews.title: Serves it’s purpose
customer_reviews.text: I like this item, it serves it’s purpose very well. The price is very fair, and I really like that it doesn’t require a special bag, which makes it even more cost effective. It contains the smell inside very well. Of course when you open the entire lid to toss out the trash in the big dumpster you can small everything, but other than that, it’s a great item.
customer_reviews.author: MONICA RONSES

customer_reviews.title: outside sticker
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the pail itself will work just fine, but it is SO annoying that they have a giant outside sticker that it is a diaper pail. I bought this for my husband who uses depends. Who wants an announcement in the bathroom you have a diaper pail. I worked very hard to get the sticker off, using all sorts of products and it looks 'okay' but not clean. Please USE a peal off sticker in the future!
customer_reviews.author: jmrf

customer_reviews.title: Effective and economical
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I've had it for a while now.. I use regular trash bags. The receptacle that holds the deodorizer disk fell of a couple of times and one of the times i missed seeing it so it went with the trash.. but instead, I keep a large "sugar dispenser bottle" filled with baking soda to sprinkle generously every couple of days and voila no stench! This is more effective that the deodorizer disk. Definite plus that I don't have to think of ordering special refills.
customer_reviews.author: Foodie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Hold Smell.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to take the bag out and replace it....but this thing holds NO SMELL. Your house will stink even if you take the bag out every day. We ended up keeping it outside all winter! I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: NMF

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Added a different deodorizer. This is a good sized pail without taking up to much space. I use 13 gallon scented trash liners. We have set up in our dining room next to the changing table with no odor.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Before this, garbage was smelly , now can fill garbage bag before disposing. Puppy pads actually can be only emptied once a week. Keeps the odor contained. Only wish it wasnt so big, or not round.
customer_reviews.author: MNSISSY1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold in stinky diaper smells
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple and easy to use diaper pail that you can use with kitchen garbage bags. Unfortunately it barely holds in dirty diaper smells. We formerly had an Ubbi pail that worked wonders for almost two years. I didn’t want to spend so much on a second pail because we’re hoping to potty train in a few months but this pail isn’t cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Dutcher

customer_reviews.title: Gap in the design, will smell
customer_reviews.text: Had to apply a patch to seal it. That's just a miss in the design.
customer_reviews.author: Sas

customer_reviews.title: No stinky super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Buy this for my room while baby sleep with me and almost 4 months and never have any odor issue. super easy to use and don't have to buy special bags. I use the 13 gallons with scent bags that I use for my kitchen trash can. I haven't replace the the odor pill that bring the container.
customer_reviews.author: michele ruiz

product_meta.title: Safety 1st Easy Saver Diaper Pail
product_meta.description:
Dispose of your diapers the clean and neat way with the Easy Saver Diaper Pail by Safety 1st.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Safety 1st Odorless Diaper Pail keeps the smell of soiled diapers out of the nursery. It is a convenient one step diaper disposal system and requires no twisting and turning - just drop the diaper in and go.
feature_bullets: Dorizer disc included; Replacement discs sold separately (23900); Warning: proposition 65 reasons:titanium dioxide, other chemicals

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,745 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
